basics.name: Jordan Terry
basics.label: Staff Android Developer | Speaker, Aviator, Coder
basics.summary: Staff Android Engineer with 10+ years building developer tools and safety-focused systems at scale. Designed compile-time validation systems and structured concurrency architectures, reducing coroutine errors by 5%. Advocate for making correct code easy to write and wrong code hard to ship. Conference speaker (Droidcon, Kotlin London) and mentor. Passionate about aviation and endurance sports.

work.name: Etsy
work.summary: Search team engineer driving safety-first architecture and developer productivity for Etsy's marketplace app.
highlights: Introduced JSON Schema validation for API contracts, enabling compile-time type safety and preventing malformed responses from reaching production
Designed MVI architecture enforcing structured concurrency, eliminating scope mismanagement bugs causing race conditions and double-refreshes
Reduced coroutine continuation errors by ~5% through compiler verification systems; influenced iOS team's Swift 6 structured concurrency adoption
Champion production observability using New Relic for proactive monitoring, debugging, and performance optimization
Transformed testing culture from low buy-in to team-wide adoption by demonstrating value and improving Turbine test patterns
Founded 'Nerd Club' technical book club (currently: Designing Data-Intensive Applications), driving cross-team collaboration and shared learning
Speaker at company events in Mexico City and NYC supporting hiring and community building

work.name: Marks & Spencer
work.summary: Platform engineer focused on build systems, shared tooling, and developer productivity for M&S's retail app.
highlights: Reduced build times by 50%+ through Gradle optimization and CI/CD pipeline improvements
Built shared tooling used across 60+ repositories, establishing reusable patterns for the organization
Implemented OAuth authentication system, gaining deep understanding of security and auth flows
Established build metrics and observability practices to track developer productivity improvements
Co-presented 'Developer Productivity on a Budget' at Droidcon London, sharing build optimization strategies

work.name: Twitter
work.summary: Built premium features for Twitter Blue and cross-platform systems at scale (millions of DAUs).
highlights: Built cross-platform data syncing using GraphQL subscriptions, coordinating real-time state across iOS, Android, and web
Developed unified card rendering system ensuring consistent behavior across all platform surfaces
Established observability practices using Interana for proactive production monitoring and issue detection
Represented Twitter as speaker at Droidcon Lisbon on build systems

work.name: The Guardian
work.summary: Led technical initiatives and product features for The Guardian's Android app over a 4-year tenure.
highlights: Led full Kotlin migration from Java, establishing patterns adopted across the codebase
Drove modularization of monolithic codebase, improving build times and maintainability through Gradle optimization
Built premium subscription system for paid content access and subscriber management
Implemented Sign in with Apple for Android (custom OAuth solution), expanding authentication options
Developed personalized marketing messaging system to drive user engagement

work.name: ClearScore
work.summary: Joined during transition from hybrid to native Android at a fast-paced fintech startup.
highlights: Contributed to full native Android rewrite, replacing hybrid app architecture
Early production Kotlin adoption, establishing foundation for modern Android development
